flatworld.extensions.baseEventlisteners.name: flatworld.extensions.baseEventlisteners
flatworld.extensions.baseEventlisteners.description:
Core plugin. Houses the default eventlisteners used in the map. When plugins are added to the map this class can be used for the
eventlistener management. Creates window.flatworld.setFullScreen function to be used when switching to fullscreen.

params.name: canvasElement
params.description:
The canvas element we listen events from. Will try to search the first canvas in the DOM,
if none is provided

flatworld.extensions.mapDrag.name: flatworld.extensions.mapDrag
flatworld.extensions.mapDrag.description:
Core plugin for the engine. Handles moving the map by dragging the map with mouse or touch event. Core plugins can always be
overwrote if needed.

flatworld.utils.Quadtree.name: flatworld.utils.Quadtree
flatworld.utils.Quadtree.description:
NOTE! NOT IN USE AT THE MOMENT. THIS WAS LESS EFFICIENT THAN USING SUBCONTAINERS, SO IT WILL BE USED IN THE FUTURE IF NEEDED.

This class handles the API for quadtree to search for the wanted objects on the certain coordinates. After this
the map should do it's own - more precise - hit detections.
requires: Quadtree-js. Though this base library can be changed easily

params.name: options
params.description: options for the QuadModule

params.name: max
params.description: How many levels deep

flatworld.utils.dataManipulation.name: flatworld.utils.dataManipulation
flatworld.utils.dataManipulation.description: These are utils for manipulating the data, that our classes and functions use.

flatworld.utils.effects.name: flatworld.utils.effects
flatworld.utils.effects.description:
This module will hold the most common graphical effects used in the map. It is still very stub as the development
hasn't proceeded to this stage yet.

flatworld.extensions.mapZoom.name: flatworld.extensions.mapZoom
flatworld.extensions.mapZoom.description:
Core plugin for the engine. Handles zooming for the map. Core plugins can always be overwrote if needed. Zooming happens when the
user scrolls the mousewheel or in mobile, pinches the screen.

flatworld.Flatworld.name: flatworld.Flatworld
flatworld.Flatworld.description:
Main class for the engine

Initializes the whole structure and plugins and is used as primary API for all operations. This class is e.g. passed to every
plugin that get initialized with their init-method.

You use the class by instantiating it (new) and then finishing initialization with init-method. Please see examples below.

The biggest part of creating the map, is the data structure. There is a clear data structure that you can see from the
tests/data-folder, but the factory is responsible for creating the objects, so you can use your own factory implementation. So to
understand more, please see e.g. {{#crossLink 'flatworld.factories.hexaFactory'}}{{/crossLink}}.

The map consists of layer on top of each other. The example is best understood when thinking typical war strategy game. The
structure is this:
1. StaticLayer: Handles things like scaling / zooming the map
2. MovableLayer: Obviously handles movement of the map. Also is a good place to get map coordinates. Since getting global
coordinates won't help you much, half of the time.
3. Different layers: like units, terrain, fog of war, UIs etc. Can also contains special layers like dynamically changed UIlayers.
4. possible subcontainers (used for optimized object selection and map movement). Can also contains special layers like dynamically
changed UIlayers.
5. Individual objects, like units, terrains, cities etc...

Plugins can be added with activatePlugins-method by sending them to the class. Plugins must always implement init-method, which
receives Map instance. Plugins are not yet restricted what they can do and can add functionality without touching map or can modify
objects or their prototypes through access to Map instance.

params.name: mapCanvas
params.description: HTML element which will be container for the created canvas element.

params.name: props
params.description: Extra properties

props.name: subcontainers
props.description:
Subcontainers size in pixels. If given, will activate subcontainers. If not
given or false, subcontainers are not used.

params.name: trackFPSCB
params.description:
Callback function for tracking FPS in renderer. So this is used for debugging
and optimizing.

flatworld.MapDataManipulator.name: flatworld.MapDataManipulator
flatworld.MapDataManipulator.description:
Class to get a consistent standard for the engine to be able to filter objects, when
etrieving or sorting them. This is used
when some method uses filters.

You must provide an object that defines how the given objects should be filtered, when
constructing. The module will filter with every rule and object given and everything that
doesn't pass one of the given filters, will be dropped out.

Given filters look something like this:
{
  type: 'filter',
  object: 'layer',
  property: 'selectable', // THIS can also be an array, like: ['data', 'a'] => data.a
  value: true,
}
For more information, please check the mapDataManipulatorSpec.js (test) for now.

params.name: rules
params.description:
REQUIRED. The rules that apply for this instance.
Multiple rules in Array or one as Object.

flatworld.maplayers.MapLayer.name: flatworld.maplayers.MapLayer
flatworld.maplayers.MapLayer.description:
Creates a basic layer for the Map. This type of layer can not hold subcontainers. Note that different devices and graphic cards can
only have specific size of bitmap drawn, and PIXI cache always draws a bitmap thus the default is: 4096, based on this site:
http://webglstats.com/ and MAX_TEXTURE_SIZE. This is important also when caching.

params.name: options
params.description: optional options

props.name: name
props.description:
Layers name, used for identifying the layer. Useful in debugging, but can be
used for finding correct layers too

props.name: coord
props.description: coord starting coords of layer. Relative to parent map layer.

props.name: specialLayer
props.description: Is this layer special (e.g. UILayer not included in normal operations)

flatworld.maplayers.MapLayerParent.name: flatworld.maplayers.MapLayerParent
flatworld.maplayers.MapLayerParent.description:
Layer designed to hold subcontainers. But can handle objects too. Different devices graphic cards can only have specific size of
bitmap drawn, and PIXI cache always draws a bitmap. Thus the default is: 4096, based on this site: http://webglstats.com/ and
MAX_TEXTURE_SIZE

props.name: name
props.description:
name layer property name, used for identifiying the layer, usefull in debugging,
but used also otherwise too

props.name: coord
props.description: starting coords of layer. Relative to parent map layer.

props.name: subcontainers
props.description: Subontainer size. If given activated subcontainers, otherwise not.

props.name: specialLayer
props.description: Is this special layer or not.

flatworld.maplayers.MapSubcontainer.name: flatworld.maplayers.MapSubcontainer
flatworld.maplayers.MapSubcontainer.description:
Subcontainers are containers that hold objects like units and terrain etc. under them. They have some restrictions atm. since they
are PIXI.ParticleContainers. But when needed we can extend MapLayers with another class which is subcontainer, but not
ParticleContainer at the present there is no need, so we won't extend yet. Subcontainers help the layers to make better movement of
the map, by making subcontainers visible or invisible and even helping with selecting objects on the map. Thus we don't need to use
our inefficient Quadtree. The intention was to use PIXI.ParticleContainer for this, but it seems it doesn't clean up the memory
afterwards the same way as normal Container.

params.name: size
params.description: Subontainer size. If given activated subcontainers, otherwise not.

flatworld.ObjectManager.name: flatworld.ObjectManager
flatworld.ObjectManager.description:
this module is responsible for doing hitTesting, like returning the units on certain clicked coordinates or when objects or areas
collide with each other.
todo:
It might be a good idea to make the hitDetection more extensive. Now it just uses point or rectangle / bounds to detect hits.
It could use sprites or forms.

flatworld.objects.ObjectSprite.name: flatworld.objects.ObjectSprite
flatworld.objects.ObjectSprite.description: The base class of all sprite objects

params.name: coords
params.description: the coordinate where the object is located at, relative to it's parent

props.name: data
props.description:
objects data, that will be used in the game. It will not actually be mainly used
in graphical but rather things  like unit-data and city-data presentations etc.

flatworld.objects.ObjectSpriteTerrain.name: flatworld.objects.ObjectSpriteTerrain
flatworld.objects.ObjectSpriteTerrain.description:
Terrain tile like desert or mountain, non-movable and cacheable. Normally, but not necessarily, these are
inherited, depending on the map type. For example you might want to add some click area for these

params.name: coords
params.description: format: {x: Number, y: Number}. Coordinates for the object relative to it's parent

params.name: data
params.description: This units custom data

flatworld.objects.ObjectSpriteUnit.name: flatworld.objects.ObjectSpriteUnit
flatworld.objects.ObjectSpriteUnit.description:
Map unit like infantry or worker, usually something with actions or movable. Usually these are extended, depending on the map type.
For example you might want to add some click area for these (e.g. hexagon)

params.name: coords
params.description: Coordinates for the object relative to it's parent

params.name: data
params.description: This units data

flatworld.UI.name: flatworld.UI
flatworld.UI.description:
Main class for showing UI on the map, like unit selections, movements and such. Has nothing to do with showing off-map data, like
datagrams of the resources player has or other players status etc.
Good examples for what this shows are: selected units-list, selection highlight (like a circle on the selected unit), unit movement.
How it works is that this is basically the interface that shows what the UI theme class can (or must) implement.

params.name: UITheme
params.description: Module that will be used for the UI theme

params.name: givenMap
params.description: Map instance that is used

flatworld.eventListeners.name: flatworld.eventListeners
flatworld.eventListeners.description:
This keeps all the event listeners and detectors in one class. You add detectors / event listener types with addDetector and you add
event listeners with on.

flatworld.mapApi.name: flatworld.mapApi
flatworld.mapApi.description: Singleton. Uses JSON only data flow

flatworld.mapEvents.name: flatworld.mapEvents
flatworld.mapEvents.description:
This module handles map events. Like informing map movement, object selection and other
changes. Not that ALL the eventlisteners and their callbacks will throw one event!
But that event will have no extra parameters, so when you do special things, like selecting
objects on the map, you should throw another event when that happens and you can pass on
the objects that were selected from the map.
This uses https://github.com/primus/eventemitter3 and follows the nodeJS event
conventions: https://nodejs.org/api/events.html
Events atm:
- mapdrag
- mapzoomed
- objectsSelected (in hexagon extension units.js)
- mapMoved
- mapResize
todo: add mapfullscreen
mapfullSize and check if something is missing from the list

flatworld.mapStates.name: flatworld.mapStates
flatworld.mapStates.description: Finite state machine for the map. Uses this library and pretty much it's API https://github.com/jakesgordon/javascript-state-machine.

flatworld.extensions.fogOfWars.pixelized.name: flatworld.extensions.fogOfWars.pixelizedMinimap
flatworld.extensions.fogOfWars.pixelized.description: Simple fog of war works with circles around objects

flatworld.extensions.fogOfWars.extension.description:
Handles the eventlistner for selecting objects on the map. THe actual logic for detecting the objects under mouse

so we need it to handle those events correctly

params.name: map
params.description: The currently use Map instance

flatworld.extensions.fogOfWars.extension.description: This manages some utility functionalities for creating hexagons

flatworld.extensions.hexagons.selectHexa.name: flatworld.extensions.hexagons.selectHexagonObject
flatworld.extensions.hexagons.selectHexa.description: Handles the selection of hexagons on the map

flatworld.extensions.mapMovement.name: flatworld.extensions.mapMovement
flatworld.extensions.mapMovement.description:
on the canvas / viewport or outside of it. It does this by getting object from larger area
than the current viewport size and then checking if the subcontainers are actually inside the
viewport or not. If inside mark them visible, if outside mark then hidden.
This makes the map a lot faster and reliable resource-wise.

flatworld.extensions.minimaps.pixelizedM.name: flatworld.extensions.minimaps.pixelizedMinimap
flatworld.extensions.minimaps.pixelizedM.description:
Pixelized minimap works in situations, where you map a symmetrical map. E.g. hexagon or square based map.
It can only be created in sizes that match pixel squares (not sure what it is called). So basically object area on the minimap can be
either 1, 4, 9, 16 etc. pixels in size.

After plugin has been initialized by the flatworld, you must still call initMinimap to start showing the minimap.

instead of separately passing them to activatePlugins method. You can provide the module strings or module objects.

callback function for tick. Tick callback is initiated in every frame. So map draws
happen during ticks.

props.description: Do we set fullsize canvas or not at the beginning. Default: true

return.description:
Returns an array of Promises. If this is empty / zero. Then there is nothing to wait
for, if it contains promises, you have to wait for them to finish for the plugins to work and map be ready.

classitems.description: Returns current subcontainers configurations (like subcontainers size).
classitems.name: getSubcontainerConfigs

classitems.description:
Get the size of the area that is shown to the player. More or less the area of the browser
window.
classitems.name: getViewportArea

params.name: isLocal
params.description:
Do we want to
use Map coordinates or global / canvas
coordinates. Default = false

return.type: X: Integer, y: Integer, width: Integer, height: Integer

classitems.description: Remove a primary layer from the map
classitems.name: removeLayer

params.name: layer
params.description:
The layer object to be
removed

classitems.description: return the mapsize as width and height

Moves the map the amount of given x and y pixels. Note that this is not the destination coordinate, but the amount of movement that
the map should move. Internally it moves the movableLayer, taking into account necessary properties (like scale). Draws map after
movement.
classitems.name: moveMap

params.name: coord
params.description:
The amount of x and y coordinates we want the map to move. I.e. { x: 5, y: 0 }. With this we
want the map to move horizontally 5 pixels and vertically stay at the same position.

params.name: absolute
params.description:
If the given coordinates are not relative, like move map 1 pixel, but instead absolute, like
move map to coordinates { x: 1, y: 2 }. Defaults to false (relative).

todo: the informcoordinates away and fix the issue they tried to fix!

classitems.description:
Activate all plugins for the map. Iterates through the given plugins we wish to activate and does the actual work in activatePlugin-
method.
classitems.name: pluginsArray

params.name: pluginsArray
params.description: Array that consists the plugin modules to be activated

return.description: Promise. If string are provided resolved those with System.import, otherwise resolves immediately.

classitems.description:
Activate plugin for the map. Plugins need .pluginName property and .init-method. Plugins init-method activates the plugins and we
call them in Map. Plugins init-metho receivse this (Map instance) as their only parameter.
classitems.name: activatePlugin

throws.description: Throws a general error if there is an issue activating the plugin

params.name: plugin
params.description: Plugin module

classitems.description: Setting new prototype methods for the Map instance
classitems.name: setPrototype

params.name: property
params.description: The property you want to set

params.name: value
params.description: Value for the property

classitems.description:
Gets object under specific map coordinates. Using subcontainers if they exist, other
methods if not. If you provide type parameter, the method returns only object types that
match it.

NOTE! At the moment filters only support layers! You can not give filters object: object and
expect them to be filtered. It will filter only layers (object: layer)!
todo: This should work with object filtering too

but the issues regarding it are
efficiency (if there are many filter rules

we don't want to go through them twice?). Since
the way filters work now
we would have to filter layers first and then again objects.
classitems.name: getObjectsUnderArea

params.name: globalCoords
params.description: Event coordinates on the staticLayer / canvas.

params.name: options
params.description: Optional options

props.name: filter
props.description: The filter to apply to subcontainers

return.description: Array of object found on the map.

classitems.description:
This returns the normal parent layers that we mostly use for manipulation everything. MovableLayer and staticLayer are built-in
layers designed to provide the basic functionalities like zooming and moving the map. These layers provide everything that extends
the map more.
classitems.name: getPrimaryLayers

params.name: {}.filters
params.description: The mapDataManipulator instance, that you use for filtering.

return.description: Basically anything in the map that is used as a layer (not really counting subcontainers).

classitems.description: Get all objects on the map, from layers and subcontainers.
todo: Not very intelligent atm. You need to make a recursive and smart retrieving of objects

so no matter how many layers or
layers there are
you always retrieve the end objects and the end of the path.
classitems.name: getAllObjects

params.name: {}.filters
params.description: The mapDataManipulator instance, that you use for filtering.

classitems.description: This returns the layer that is responsible for map zoom
classitems.name: getZoomLayer

classitems.description: Set map zoom. 1 = no zoom. <1 zoom out, >1 zoom in.
classitems.name: setZoom

params.name: scale
params.description: The amount of zoom you want to set

classitems.description: Get map zoom. 1 = no zoom. <1 zoom out, >1 zoom in.
classitems.name: getZoom

classitems.description: Returns the PIXI renderer. Don't use this unless you must. For more advanced or PIXI specific cases.
classitems.name: getRenderer

classitems.description: Return static layer. The static layer is the topmost of all layers. It handles zooming and other non-movable operations.
classitems.name: getStaticLayer

classitems.description:
Returns movable layer. This layer is the one that moves when the player moves the map. So this is used for things that are relative
to the current map position the player is seeing. This can be used e.g. when you want to display some objects on the map or UI
elements, like effects that happen on certain point on the map.
classitems.name: getMovableLayer

classitems.description: Return minimap layer. Holds minimap, if used in the game.
classitems.name: getMinimapLayer

classitems.description: Removes the minimapLayer from the game.

This is abstract method and needs to be implemented with a plugin. Core module has an implementation for this and if you don't
implement your own, I suggest you use it.
classitems.name: zoomIn

classitems.description:
This is abstract method and needs to be implemented with a plugin. Core module has an implementation for this and if you don't
implement your own, I suggest you use it.
classitems.name: zoomOut

classitems.description: Resize the canvas to fill the whole browser content area. Defined by the baseEventlisteners-module (core modules plugin)
classitems.name: toggleFullsize

classitems.description: Toggles fullscreen mode. Defined by the baseEventlisteners-module (core modules plugin)
classitems.name: toggleFullScreen

classitems.description: Plugin will overwrite create this method. Method for actually activating minimap.
classitems.name: initMinimap

classitems.description: Plugin will overwrite create this method. Method for actually activating fog of war.
classitems.name: activateFogOfWar

classitems.description: Retrieves the objects from ObjectManager, with the given parameters. Mostly helper functionality for getObjectsUnderArea
classitems.name: _retrieveObjects

params.name: allCoords
params.description: REQUIRED

params.name: {}.type
params.description: The type of objects we want

params.name: {}.subcontainers
params.description: Array of the subcontainers we will search

classitems.description: This returns layers by filtering them based on certain attribute. Can be used with more higher order filtering
classitems.name: _getLayersWithAttributes

classitems.description: Get subcontainers under certain point or rectangle
classitems.name: _getSubcontainersUnderPoint

params.name: options
params.description: Optional options.

return.description: All subcontainers that matched the critea

classitems.description:
This handles the default drawing of the map, so that map always updates when drawOnNextTick === true. This tick
callback is always set and should not be removed or overruled
classitems.name: _defaultTick

classitems.description:
This has exceptional query, since it actually queries it's parent. Subcontainers have
really no useful values and they are dumb
containers of objects, every data is on their parent container
classitems.name: filter

params.name: objects
params.description: The objects that are being filtered

return.description: The found objects in an Array

classitems.description: adds a filter rule
classitems.name: addRule

params.name: rules
params.description: Rules to add

classitems.description: Checks if this filter instance is set to filter the given type.

params.name: type
params.description: Type of the filter we want to check

classitems.description: This is the actual method that runs through the rules and arranges the data
classitems.name: _runRule

classitems.description: This is the actual method that runs through the rules and arranges the data
classitems.name: _getObject

classitems.description: Layers name, used for identifying the layer. Useful in debugging, but can be used for finding correct layers too
classitems.name: name

classitems.description: Is this layer special (e.g. UILayer not included in normal operations)
classitems.name: specialLayer

classitems.description: Will this layer change dynamically or can we assume that this holds the same objects always, until game reload
classitems.name: static

classitems.description: Can you select objects from this layer. For example with Map.getObjectsUnderArea
classitems.name: selectable

classitems.description:
Every added UIObject will be listed here for removal and updating. The indexes in the list provide the easy option to remove only
certain object from the UIObjects.
classitems.name: UIObjectList

classitems.description: Does this layer use subcontainers.
classitems.name: hasSubcontainers

classitems.description: Move layer based on given amounts
classitems.name: move

params.name: coord
params.description:
The amount of x and y coordinates we want the layer to move. I.e. { x: 5, y: 0 }. This would move
the map 5 pixels horizontally and 0 pixels vertically

classitems.description: set layer zoom
classitems.name: setZoom

params.name: amount
params.description: The amount that you want the layer to zoom.

return.description: The same amount that was given, except after transform to 2 decimals and type cast to Number

classitems.description: get layer zoom
classitems.name: getZoom

classitems.description: get UIObjects on this layer, if there are any, or defaulty empty array if no UIObjects are active
classitems.name: getUIObjects

classitems.description: Get primary layers, that this layer holds as children. So basically all children that are not special layers (such as UI layers etc.)
classitems.name: getPrimaryLayers

return.description: Primary children layers under this layer

classitems.description: Get all objects that are this layers children or subcontainers children. Does not return layers, but the objects. Works on primary layer only currently. So can not seek for complicated children structure, seeks only inside subcontainers.
classitems.name: getObjects

return.description: All the objects (not layers) found under this layer

classitems.description:
Create and add special layer, that holds UI effects in it. UILayer is normally positioned as movableLayers 3rd child. And the
actual UI stuff is added there.
classitems.name: createUILayer

params.name: name
params.description: name of the layer

params.name: coord
params.description: Coordinates of the layer

classitems.description: Return the UILayer. If no UILayer is yet created, will return undefined
classitems.name: getUILayer

classitems.description:
Adds and object to this layers UILayer child. If an object with the same name already exists, we remove it automatically and replace
it with the new object given as parameter.
classitems.name: addUIObject

params.name: object
params.description: The UI object to be added under this layer

params.name: UIName
params.description: Name of the UI object. This is important as you can use it to remove the UI object later or replace it.

return.description: All the UIObjects currently on this layer

classitems.description: If object is given, removes that object, otherwiseRemove all the UIObjects from this layer
classitems.name: deleteUIObjects

params.name: object
params.description: If you wish to delete particular object

classitems.description:
We override the PIXIs own addchild functionality. Since we need to support subcontainers in
addChild. We check subcontainers and
then we call the original (PIXIs) addChild
classitems.name: addChild

params.name: displayObject
params.description: PIXI.DisplayObject

params.name: scale
params.description: The size of scale the map currently has

params.name: options.toGlobal
params.description: Do we get the global coordinates or local

return.description: x, y, width and height returned inside object.

classitems.description:
Helper function for setting subcontainers to parent containers. Adds subcontainers when
needed. Subcontainers are not and can not be initialized at the start as we won't know the
size of the parent container. Container is always dynamic in size.

Size of the rectangle area to match against, if we want to match rectangle

If this object is static. Meaning it's position won't be changed etc. This can be used e.g. in rendering the minimap. The static

classitems.description:
This is abstract method and needs to be implemented with a plugin. Core module has an implementation for this and if you
don't implement your own, I suggest you use it. You can attach any method to object if you wish. Like attack, siege, greet, talk.
classitems.name: [name]

params.name: name
params.description: Name of the sound to stop playing

params.description: Name / identifier of the sound

params.name: to
params.description: Volume to fade to

params.name: duration
params.description: Time in milliseconds to fade

return.description: Promise that resolves after fade is complete

classitems.description:
Responsible for showing what objects have been selected for inspection or if the player selects only one object, we hightlihgt it.
For example if there are several objects in one tile on the map and the player needs to be able to select one
specific unit on the stack. This is always defined in the UI theme-module Selecting one unit, highlight it, which means,
e.g. bringing the unit on top on the map and showing selection circle around it.
classitems.name: showSelections

params.name: objects
params.description: Objects that have been selected.

params.name: getDatas
params.description:
This is an object made of functions, that get wanted data from the object. For example if
you have objects name in object.data.specialData.name, then you have an object getDatas.name(), which retrieves this. This should be
standardized maybe in MapDataManipulator, so that we can change the template between different game setups easier. Lets say if one
game modification has different attributes than another, then maybe it should still have standard interface.
Extra options

props.name: options
props.description: Extra options that are passed to the UITheme class

todo: the getDatas function should be standardized
so that most UIs would work with most different setups.

classitems.description: Shows arrow or movement or what ever to indicate the selected unit is moving to the given location
classitems.name: showUnitMovement

params.name: options
params.description: Extra options. Like dropping a shadow etc.

params.name: newMethod

params.name: type
params.description: REQUIRED. The type of event. This type has been created with setDetector.

params.name: cb
params.description: Callback to do it's eventlistener magic.

classitems.description:
Sets the state of the event. State is very important e.g. for fluent dragging and selecting. When we start to drag, we avoid
selecting units and vice versa, when we keep an event state tracking through this.

params.description: EventType

params.name: type
params.description: Event type

Event gets fired when the specific eventListener trigger. The name consists of "Map" + the given event type, like such:

classitems.description: Get data from server

params.name: name
params.description: The indentifier for this API call / endpoint

return.description: ES6 native Promise as the API advances

classitems.name: post

params.name: name
params.description: The indentifier for this API call / endpoint

params.name: params
params.description:
Params that are sent to the callbacks that have been attached to handle this API data. E.g. at least the
POST data that will be sent to server needs to be set in the callback to the object.body property.

return.description: ES6 native Promise as the API advances

classitems.description: Add a new mapApi endpoint
classitems.name: add

params.name: type
params.description: Basically the name of the mapAPI. Like 'moveUnit'.

params.name: cb
params.description:
Callback that returns the data that is sent to this API endpoint. Callback gets these parameters
1. request type: post, get etc.
2. completeData: { baseUrl, cbs }
3. params: params that were sent to the mapAPI function as extra, like in post(type, params)
HAS to return:
{}.body = the data to be sent
{}.url = url where the data is sent to

params.name: baseUrl
params.description: The url where the mapApi queries are sent to

classitems.description: Removes mapApi endpoint
classitems.name: remove

params.name: type
params.description: Basically the name of the mapAPI. Like 'moveUnit'.

classitems.description: Add a new mapApi endpoint
classitems.name: update

params.name: type
params.description: Basically the name of the mapAPI. Like 'moveUnit'.

params.name: cb
params.description: Callback that returns the data that is sent to this API endpoint

params.name: what
params.description: The update made

params.name: params
params.description:
Params that are sent to the callbacks that have been attached to handle this API data. E.g. at least
the POST data that will be sent to server needs to be set in the callback to the object.body property.

classitems.description:
Credits belong to: https://github.com/alforno-productions/HexPixiJs/blob/master/lib/hexPixi.js
Creates a hex shaped polygon that is used for the hex's hit area.
classitems.name: createHexagon

params.name: radius
params.description: Radius of the hexagon
*OPTIONAL*

props.name: orientation
props.description: Is the heaxgon grid horizontal or vertical. Default: 'horizontal"

return.description: Hexagon shaped PIXI.Polygon object. That houses the hexagons corner points.

params.description: Radius of the hexagon

params.name: options
params.description:
Options, such as:
                             color: The fill color of the hexagon
                             isFlatTop (Boolean), is the heaxgon flat-topped

return.description: Graphics object that is shaped as hexagon, based on given radius and options.

extra options, like generating horizontal hexagon points and

Separate because these are outside the

classitems.description:
Calculates the closest hexagon center coordinates, for the given coordinates. So aligning the given coordinates to proper hexagon
coordinates

params.name: coordinates

classitems.description:
This one checks the that the objects that should currently be visible in the viewport area
are visible and outside
of the viewport objects are set .visible = false. This affect performance a lot. Basically
when the map moves, we
set a check in the future based on the given intervalCheck milliseconds. And immediately
after it we check if there
is another map movement. If there is we set another timeout. This works better with
timeouts.
classitems.name: check

params.name: map
params.description: The current Map instance
